results.title: The Great artesian basin
results.creator_credit: Tim Sullivan, Ron Saunders and Filmhouse
results.brief_description: This film explains the geological process whereby the Great Artesian Basin was formed. It explains how artesian wells function.

results.title: The Goodies and the beanstalk
results.creator_credit: J.H. Davies, Jim Franklin, Bob Spiers and BBC
results.brief_description: They’ll do anything, anytime, anywhere - and they’ve got the bike to prove it. Here are three episodes of classic high-brow comedy starring Tim Brooke-Taylor, Bill Oddie and Graeme Garden. THE GOODIES AND THE BEANSTALK: Cricklewood, 1973: poverty stricken, the Goodies sell their tandem for a tin of beans - which, when planted, grows into a giant beanstalk leading up Mt Everest to the giant’s castle where golden eggs are laid. But before the Goodies can become rich, they must battle with the Giant. Note: this is the 43 minute Christmas version. Guest stars Michael Aspel. THE END: The office is entombed under a pillar of concrete in line with Graeme’s new city development plan. Isolated, the Goodies explore their relationships with each other, politics, religion and eye-spy. THE BUNFIGHT AT THE O.K. TEA ROOMS: The Goodies go west (well, Cornwall) to mine for gold, but strike cream instead. Graeme monopolises the cream business by sneaking off on the other two, but Tim and Bill also find strawberry jam and scones. The stakes are set for a poker game where winner takes all, and culminates in the Bunfight at the O.K. Tea Rooms.

results.title: The Goodies: Kitten Kong
results.creator_credit: J.H. Davies, Jim Franklin, Bob Spiers and BBC
results.brief_description: They’ll do anything, anytime, anywhere - and they’ve got the bike to prove it. Here are three episodes of classic high-brow comedy starring Tim Brooke-Taylor, Bill Oddie and Graeme Garden. KITTEN KONG: When the Goodies turn to matters veterinary, Graeme invents a new super pet food. Promotes rapid growth, he claims - right up to the ceiling? SCATTY SAFARI: Television personalities are proving to be a less than popular attraction at the Goodies’ safari park, so they get a pair of Rolf Harrises to breed. But the Rolf Harrises escape and breed far too well, reaching plague proportions. Guest stars Tony Blackburn, Sheila Steafel and David Willmott. SCOUTRAGEOUS: Tim’s secret vice is being a boy scout - until scouting is made illegal, thanks to the Masked Scouts intent on collecting every single merit badge up to and including the World Domination Badge.

results.title: Working agreement
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
Shows how an industrial award comes into being, tracing the progress of a new log of claims by workers as it moves from negotiations between unions and employers thorugh to the Conciliation and Arbitration Commission. Cast includes Henri Szeps, Gordon Piper, Maggie Kirkpatrick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Weedy plot
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
One of a series of films which is designed to help bring about a better understanding of how our legal processes work in solving the everyday human conflicts and disputes. This is a case about an employee fired for rudeness. Cast includes Don Pasere, Wendy Playfair, Les Foxcraft, Ken Goodlet.

results.title: The Good oil
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Wayne Le Clos, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A funny, true to life story about a group of residents and their conflict with a nearby factory management. The residents’ indignation over sleepless nights and spoiled washing has its funny moments but the way is opened for serious questions about our changing environment

results.title: Buying blues
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A young girl takes a clothing retailer to the Consumer Claims Tribunal claiming that her newly purchased jeans were falsely represented. The complainant, the trader and their witnesses give different versions of what happened at the point of sale. The referee has to decide where the truth lies. Based on a true story. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Accident
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A serious accident brings a tragic end to the dreams and ambitions of a young migrant worker. Looks at the rights of workers and the responsibility of management in industrial accidents. Opens up for consideration the alternatives of Workers Compensation or suing under judge made law.
